overview.business_description: Italian telecommunications infrastructure provider delivering passive fiber optic access and advanced network services primarily to operators in the fixed broadband sector. Operates through a co-investment model facilitating Italy's fiber network rollout.
business_positives: Critical infrastructure for Italy's fiber broadband
Strong consortium backing (KKR 52.5%, ADIA 20%, CPP, F2i)
Monopolistic position in Italian fiber network
overview.fatal_flaw: Very high leverage (6.0x net, 8.0x gross); heavy capex requirements (~$3bn/year) exceed operating cash flow; negative rating outlooks from Moody's and S&P
overview.ownership: KKR (52.5%), ADIA (20%), CPP Investments, F2i SGR
overview.recent_news: Jun 2025: Issued EUR 2.8bn triple-tranche senior secured bonds. Jun 2025: S&P and Moody's revised outlook to negative on capex-driven releveraging. Jun 2025: Fitch assigned first-time BB rating (stable). Nov 2023: KKR consortium acquired from TIM SpA for EUR 23.3bn.

equity_market_value.note: Private - KKR consortium acquired from TIM SpA for EUR 23.3bn (Nov 2023)

key_deals.deal: EUR 2.8bn triple-tranche senior secured bonds (4.75% 2030, FRN 2031, 5.13% 2032)
KKR consortium acquired 100% from TIM SpA for EUR 23.3bn
KKR acquired initial 42% from TIM for EUR 2.3bn

credit_opinion.summary: FiberCop is Italy's dominant fiber infrastructure provider carved out of TIM SpA in 2023. KKR-led consortium paid EUR 23.3bn reflecting strategic value of Italy's fiber network. Very high leverage (6.0x net, 8.0x gross) and capex-intensive rollout (~$3bn/year) result in negative free cash flow. Rating outlooks turned negative in Jun 2025 on releveraging concerns. Secured bonds yield 4.2-5.2% reflecting infrastructure quality.
key_catalysts: Completion of fiber rollout reducing capex
credit_opinion.recommendation: UNDERWEIGHT - Critical infrastructure but leverage too high and negative FCF; wait for capex peak to pass
